dialogue.text: See how each stone asks 'What supports me?' and 'What do I support?' The whole cathedral is built from questions, not answers. 'What am I?' is the cornerstone that holds it all.
dialogue.visual_cue: touching cornerstone that pulses with questions

dialogue.text: So consciousness isn't the building but the building process?
Every time you ask 'What am I?' you lay another stone. The question doesn't complete the cathedralâ€”it IS the cathedral, always under construction, always reaching higher.
dialogue.visual_cue: new stones appearing with each question

dialogue.text: Then I'm not fallen ruins but rising cathedral!
The most beautiful cathedrals are never finished. They keep asking 'What am I becoming?' with every new stone, every new day, every new light through their windows.

philosophical_notes.wisdom_element: incompletion as highest form of completion
